---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>

</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11217712511/job/31179858909)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11217712511/job/31179859314)

Some minor comments but LGTM.

There is certainly room for further clean up but this is a big step in the right direction.

Thanks.

bors d+
Just a few superficial remarks for now
LGTM but I don't know this part of the library that well!

Some minor comments but LGTM.

There is certainly room for further clean up but this is a big step in the right direction.

Thanks.

bors d+
This already exists as `LinearMap.iterateKer` (more precisely as `f.iterateKer.monotone hkl`).

I quite like using the notation:
```suggestion
lemma mem_unifEigenspace {f : End R M} {μ : R} {k : ℕ∞} {x : M} :
```
(also elsewhere)

I'd be tempted to bundle in the monotonicity:
```suggestion
def unifEigenspace (f : End R M) (μ : R) : ℕ∞ →o Submodule R M where
  toFun k := ⨆ l : ℕ, ⨆ _ : l ≤ k, LinearMap.ker ((f - μ • 1) ^ l)
  monotone' k l hkl x := by
    sorry
```

Can this be `simp`?
```suggestion
@[simp] lemma mem_unifEigenspace_one {f : End R M} {μ : R} {x : M} :
```

And this?
```suggestion
@[simp] lemma mem_unifEigenspace_zero {f : End R M} {μ : R} {x : M} :
```
simp can prove this one using the lemma below it.
This docstring looks out of date?
Similar for some of the ones below
Can/should we bundle this as a `↪o` instead?
Good point. Done

Can we have a rewrite lemma for `unifEigenspace_top` (with an iSup over Nat on the rhs rather than the subtype). It's the same content as `maxGenEigenspace_def` but something with name referencing `unifEigenspace` would be helpful in my view

```suggestion
    CompleteLattice.Independent f.maxGenEigenspace := by
```
might work (untested). If not, maybe the cool dot syntax could be nice - up to you.

```suggestion
private lemma mem_unifEigenspace_aux {f : End R M} {μ : R} {k : ℕ∞} {x : M} :
    x ∈ f.unifEigenspace_aux μ k ↔ ∃ l : ℕ, l ≤ k ∧ x ∈ LinearMap.ker ((f - μ • 1) ^ l) := by
  have : Nonempty {l : ℕ // l ≤ k} := ⟨⟨0, zero_le _⟩⟩
  rw [unifEigenspace_aux, iSup_subtype', Submodule.mem_iSup_of_directed]
  · simp only [LinearMap.mem_ker, Subtype.exists, exists_prop]
  exact Monotone.directed_le fun m n h => by simpa using (f - μ • 1).iterateKer.monotone h

private lemma unifEigenspace_aux_mono (f : End R M) (μ : R) :
    Monotone (f.unifEigenspace_aux μ) := fun _ _ hkl => biSup_mono fun _ hi => hi.trans hkl
```

I couldn't resist golfing these a bit - entirely optional if you want to use it.

This should go as it is bundled into the type.
```suggestion
```
(in other words, this is already available via `OrderHom.monotone`)
Yes! Thanks for catching this
This lemma makes it clear that the predicate `Module.End.HasGenEigenvalue` should not exist. It would be nice to excise it (though not necessarily as part of these changes).
I would be happy to do this in a follow-up PR.

Why keep this?

I would have expected that we drop this, and that what is here called `unifEigenspace` would take this name.

That is definitely my plan. But I would prefer to do it in multiple steps.
First extend the API, then deprecate the old one, then rename.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(LinearAlgebra/Eigenspace): unified definition of (max(gen)?)?Eigenspace
